definition: important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!

sentences.english: Nothing is more terrible than activity without insight.
sentences.chinese: 最可帕的事莫如做任何活動，沒有洞察力。

sentences.english: It would be better to go for a walk than stay at home all alone.
sentences.chinese: 與其坐在家裏發悶，莫如出去走走。

sentences.english: Our ancestor's secrets remain safe - at least for now.
sentences.chinese: 至少目前爲止，這些人類祖先的祕密仍然諱莫如深。

sentences.english: China manages its reserves with considerable secrecy.
sentences.chinese: 中國於外匯儲備經營之道一向諱莫如深。

sentences.english: Things in life than the books.
The lack of transparency from Apple creates a perfect storm for short-term traders.
sentences.chinese: 蘋果的諱莫如深爲短線交易者帶來了一場完美風暴。

sentences.english: There is no paradise on earth equal to the union of love and innocence .
sentences.chinese: 人間最大的幸福莫如既有愛情又清白得空。

sentences.english: No doctor is like a true friend.
sentences.chinese: 最好的醫生莫如真正的朋友。

sentences.english: Wong Kwong Yu about how to start their own has been a closely-guarded secret.
sentences.chinese: 黃光裕對於自己如何起家，一直諱莫如深。

sentences.english: Details of his health have been kept secret by the Cuban government.
sentences.chinese: 古巴政府對他的健康詳情諱莫如深。

sentences.english: It has reason to be diffident.
So standing still, nurturing pace, so that the body in motion to promote vitality.
sentences.chinese: 所以站立不動，莫如踱步，使機體在運動中增進活力。

sentences.english: It is by this " gradualness" that the Creator deceives all humans.
sentences.chinese: 造物主騙人的手段，也莫如“漸”。

sentences.english: Despite such overdrafts word about it, but it is in reality.
sentences.chinese: 儘管人們對這類透支諱莫如深，但它卻是現實存在。

definition: classical final particle, similar to modern 了[le5]
not as good as/not equal to/inferior
that being the case/then/in that case
since ancient times/it has ever been the case that/see also 自古以來|自古以来[zi4 gu3 yi3 lai2]
none doesn't/there is none who isn't/everyone
numerous/common people (or populace)/born of a concubine
last day of a lunar month/dark/night
